definition: to hold/to embrace/to wrap around/to gather around (sb)/to throng/to swarm/to support/Taiwan pr. [yong3]
to put on or wear (glasses, hat, gloves etc)/to respect/to bear/to support

sentences.english: But everybody is clamouring for the First Lady.
sentences.chinese: 但大家一致擁戴第一夫人。

sentences.english: And as for 15 years, rice at permanent residents, the acclaimed by the mayor.
sentences.chinese: 又擔任拉賴因堡15年常任市長，深受市民的擁戴。

sentences.english: Today, there are those who claim to have representatives of the Sion strain especially in the U.
sentences.chinese: 如今在美國有着許多擁戴西翁品系的無數代言人。

sentences.english: The professor's charisma must speak for itself. All the students love him.
sentences.chinese: 教授以自己的人格魅力，成爲學生們擁戴的對象。
大家歡呼擁戴他爲國王。

sentences.english: There's a Russian proverb that goes: you must support the most talented people because untalented people will support themselves.
sentences.chinese: 有一句俄羅斯諺語說，你須擁戴賢人，庸者僅會自顧。

sentences.english: Wang Yuanfeng gets common people support accordingly, should go up the county makes.
sentences.chinese: 王元豐因此得到百姓擁戴，當上縣令。

sentences.english: They made him king of England.
sentences.chinese: 他們擁戴他爲英國國王。

definition: to see, hear and obey (idiom); to take advice/to take sb at his word
to fight openly and maneuver covertly (idiom)
to think highly of oneself (idiom); giving oneself airs/arrogant and self-important
to curry favor (idiom); playing up to those in power/social climbing
scramble for power and profit (idiom); power struggle
